<item>
      <title>Apple Invests $1 Billion in Didi, Uber's Rival in China</title>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">SB12034167747834603857704582063200388516244</guid>
      <link>http://www.wsj.com/articles/apple-invests-1-billion-in-didi-ubers-rival-in-china-1463106590?mod=rss_Technology</link>
      <description>Apple is betting $1 billion on China’s homegrown competitor to Uber, marking the technology giant’s largest investment in a critical market at a time when its global fortunes are flagging.</description>

      <media:content xmlns:media="http://search.yahoo.com/mrss"
               url="http://s.wsj.net/public/resources/images/BN-NZ950_0513di_G_20160512222608.jpg" 
               type="image/jpeg"
               medium="image"
               height="369"
               width="553"> 
    <media:description>image</media:description>
    </media:content>
    <category>PAID</category>
    <pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 03:38:49 EDT</pubDate>
    </item>

<item>
      <title>Apple's New Classroom Experiment</title>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">SB10459468694179103895404582008823872285312</guid>
      <link>http://www.wsj.com/articles/apple-steps-up-effort-to-reach-classrooms-1463082073?mod=rss_Technology</link>
      <description>Apple is using technology to help level the playing field between rich and poor students. The company, which committed $100 million to the nationwide effort in 2014, assigns an employee to spend 17 days a year at each school.</description>

<item>
      <title>U.S. and Chinese Tech Firms Team Up on Sensor Networks</title>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">SB12034167747834603857704582062541114724120</guid>
      <link>http://www.wsj.com/articles/u-s-and-chinese-tech-firms-team-up-on-sensor-networks-for-smart-cities-1463081921?mod=rss_Technology</link>
      <description>China plans to spend heavily on technology to help cities cope with headaches like air pollution and traffic jams—and perhaps unruly mobs and outlaws. Silicon Valley companies are teaming up to seize the opportunity despite civil liberties issues.</description>

      <media:content xmlns:media="http://search.yahoo.com/mrss"

      <guid isPermaLink="false">SB10858104476864094641304582062852561255894</guid>
      <link>http://www.wsj.com/articles/symantec-ends-lackluster-year-amid-scaled-back-expectations-1463092238?mod=rss_Technology</link>
      <description>Symantec said it would cut about 10% of its work force and close some facilities under a restructuring plan that would result in a charge of up to $280 million.</description>

<item>

      <guid isPermaLink="false">SB12034167747834603857704582062442776750630</guid>
      <link>http://www.wsj.com/articles/mobileye-to-provide-car-companies-with-autonomous-systems-1463077526?mod=rss_Technology</link>
      <description>Mobileye N.V. has agreements to provide two separate car companies with systems for fully autonomous cars in 2019, deals that give a clearer timetable for when auto makers believe they can start producing vehicles entirely capable of driving themselves.  </description>

    <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 20:49:58 EDT</pubDate>

      <description>Businesses in the semiconductor sector are finding it more difficult to hire CFOs who can lead transformational change in the complex industry.
